abstract: Oracle’s chief executive, Larry Ellison, said he can prove that Hewlett-Packard’s incoming C.E.O. oversaw a scheme to steal Oracle’s software by rival SAP.
snippet: Oracle’s chief executive, Larry Ellison, said he can prove that Hewlett-Packard’s incoming C.E.O. oversaw a scheme to steal Oracle’s software by rival SAP.
lead_paragraph: Oracle‘s chief executive, Larry Ellison, said he can prove that Hewlett-Packard‘s incoming C.E.O. oversaw an SAP scheme to steal Oracle’s software, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Ellison Claims Proof of Wrongdoing by New H.P. Chief

abstract: U.S. companies are hoarding almost $1 trillion in cash, which they are more likely to spend on on share repurchases and mergers and acquisitions a the economy stabilizes, rather than expanding their business and hiring new employee, Moody’s Investors Service said on Tuesday.
snippet: U.S. companies are hoarding almost $1 trillion in cash, which they are more likely to spend on on share repurchases and mergers and acquisitions a the economy stabilizes, rather than expanding their business and hiring new employee, Moody’s Invest...
lead_paragraph: American companies are hoarding almost $1 trillion in cash, but are unlikely to spend on expanding their businesses and hiring new employees because of continuing uncertainty about the strength of the economy, Moody’s Investors Service says.

headline.main: U.S. Companies Hoarding Almost $1 Trillion in Cash

abstract: Larry Ellison of Oracle has escalated the rhetoric against rival Hewlett-Packard and its new C.E.O., Leo Apotheker, ahead of a corporate espionage trial that involves SAP, Mr. Apotheker’s former company.
snippet: Larry Ellison of Oracle has escalated the rhetoric against rival Hewlett-Packard and its new C.E.O., Leo Apotheker, ahead of a corporate espionage trial that involves SAP, Mr. Apotheker’s former company.
lead_paragraph: There’s nothing DealBook loves more than a good ol’ spat over allegations of corporate espionage. And we love them even more when they involve Larry Ellison.
